gradeLevel.tooltip: Select the academic grade level of the students this rubric is for.

pointScale.tooltip: Define the maximum possible score for the assignment.

standard.tooltip: Choose the type of standard or objective the rubric should be based on.

assignmentDescription.tooltip: Describe the assignment in detail. What are the students expected to do?

additionalCustomization.tooltip: Enter any extra details or specific focus areas for the rubric.

gradeLevel.tooltip: Select the student's academic grade level to tailor the feedback appropriately.

assignmentDescription.tooltip: Provide the original assignment prompt or a brief description of what the student was asked to do.

feedbackType.tooltip: Choose whether you want general feedback or feedback based on a formal rubric structure.

additionalInstructions.tooltip: Add any specific instructions, like 'focus on the introduction' or 'check for run-on sentences'.

writingContent.tooltip: Paste the complete text of the student's writing that you want to get feedback on.

gradeLevel.tooltip: Select the target grade level for the questions to adjust their complexity.

numberOfQuestions.tooltip: Enter the total number of questions you want to generate.

questionType.tooltip: Choose the type of questions you want to generate, like 'Multiple Choice' or 'True/False'.

questionLevel.tooltip: Select the difficulty level for the questions.

uploadContentType.tooltip: Choose the source of your content: paste plain text, upload a document, or use an existing study plan.

description.tooltip: Paste the text passage that the questions should be based on. This is required for 'Plain Text' content type.

studyPlan.tooltip: Select one of your saved study plans to generate questions from its topics.

topics.tooltip: Select one or more topics from the chosen study plan to focus the question generation.

summaryLengthType.tooltip: Choose the format for your summary, such as paragraphs, bullet points, or a specific word count.

summaryLengthNumber.tooltip: Specify the exact count for the summary type you selected (e.g., enter '3' for 3 paragraphs or '100' for 100 words).

originalText.tooltip: Paste the text you want to summarize. This is optional if you are uploading a document.

translateLanguage.tooltip: Enter the language you want to translate the text into, e.g., 'Spanish', 'Japanese', 'Hindi'.

translateText.tooltip: Paste the original text that you want to translate here.

gradeLevel.tooltip: Select the student's academic grade level to tailor the study plan.

plan.tooltip: Describe your specific goal or ask a question about the plan. For example, 'Create a plan focusing on weak areas like Algebra and Geometry'.

days.tooltip: Enter the total number of days you have to prepare for the exam.

subject.tooltip: Specify the main subject of the study plan, such as 'Physics', 'History', or 'General Studies'.

exam_name.tooltip: Enter the name of the exam you are preparing for, e.g., 'SAT', 'UPSC Prelims'.

syllabus_text.tooltip: Optionally, paste the detailed syllabus here to make the plan more accurate.

image.tooltip: Optionally, upload an image of your syllabus (PDF, JPG, PNG).

per_question_time.tooltip: Set the average time (in minutes) you want to allocate for each practice question.

per_exam_questions.tooltip: Define how many questions (5-30) should be in each practice test.

uploadedImage.tooltip: Upload an image file (JPG, PNG) containing a single math problem.

searchQuery.tooltip: Enter keywords, topics, author names, or titles to find relevant academic research papers.

examName.tooltip: Enter the name of the competitive exam you are preparing for to get relevant current affairs questions.

country.tooltip: Select a country to view top news headlines from that region.

language.tooltip: Choose the language for the news articles.

prompt.tooltip: Describe the concept you want the AI to explain and illustrate, for example, 'photosynthesis' or 'the water cycle'.

equation.tooltip: Enter a mathematical equation. Use Python syntax (e.g., '**' for power). For example: y = sin(x)

dimension.tooltip: Select the dimensionality of the plot (1D, 2D, or 3D).

range.tooltip: Set the minimum and maximum values for each axis.

parameters.tooltip: Define any constants or parameters used in your equation, e.g., 'a=1, b=2'.

points.tooltip: Set the number of points to calculate for the plot. More points mean a smoother curve but slower generation.

smilesOrFormula.tooltip: Enter a chemical formula (e.g., H2O) or a SMILES string (e.g., CCO for ethanol) to generate a 3D model.

syllabusFile.tooltip: Upload your syllabus (PDF, DOC, or image) to tailor the viva questions to your curriculum.

topic.tooltip: Enter the main subject of your presentation. Be as specific as you like.

slideCount.tooltip: Select the total number of slides you want the AI to generate.

audience.tooltip: Describe your audience to help the AI tailor the content's tone and complexity (e.g., 'university students', 'business executives').
